title: What are the principles of monitoring and evaluation? - Quora

response.answer_text: Monitoring and evaluation are part of the control process. So, to have successful monitoring and evaluation you first need to define a reference value, or standard value that is used as a benchmark. Afterwards, you need to define allowed deviation (usually in percentages) or the allowed marginal values above and below the benchmark. When your results are above or below standard value it means that you are performing differently than expected or that there are anomalies in the system.

Monitoring; a person who observes a process or activity to check that it is carried out fairly or correctly, especially in an official capacity: the independent judicial monitor. Evaluation; the making of a judgment about the amount, number, or value of something; assessment: the evaluation of each method | an initial evaluation of the program. There you have it, now the only way to start is to commence.
